intro: Galium noricum, commonly known as the Alpine bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated margin, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium noricum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes.
